title: Bok Choy
description: Bok Choy is used in many dishes due to its crisp texture, sweet flavor and nutritional value. It is also known as white cabbage.

title: Snake Beans
description: Snake beans are long and slender green pods with a sweet flavour and crunchy texture. Snake beans have a similar texture to that of green beans, but are slightly lighter green in colour.

title: Sorrel Leaves
description: Sorrel is a leafy green vegetable that is native to Europe. It has a sharp, lemony taste.

title: Rocket Leaves
description: Rocket leaves or popularly known as arugula or salad rocket is nutritious green-leafy vegetable. The young tender leaves carry a bitter peppery flavor that makes it mostly a salad vegetable.

title: Drumstick
description: Drum stick or horseradish tree is a tall slender plant grown for it greens, flowers and nutritious pods. It is a very commonly used vegetable in Indian household.

title: Cherry Tomatoes
description: Cherry tomatoes are a smaller variety of the garden tomatoes, which are comparatively sweeter than the larger fruits.

title: Kaffir Lime
description: Kaffir lime is a rough bumpy green citrus fruit originating from Southeast Asia. The leaves also feature in many recipes because of their aromatic properties.

title: Plantain
description: Hindi title: Vaayaka They belong to the banana family but are firmer and not consumed raw.

title: Turnip
description: A white bulb taproot vegetable. The leaves and the root have a pungent bitterly taste, similar to raw cabbages and radishes.

title: Sweet Potatoes
description: In China, sweet potatoes, typically of the yellow variety, are baked in a large iron drum, and sold as street-food during winter.

title: Round Gourd
description: A mall round gourd, also called baby pumpkin, is a vegetable grown for its immature fruit.

title: Ridge Gourd
description: A long vegetable with a dark green ridged skin and a white spongy flesh with soft seeds.

title: Pimiento
description: These look like smaller versions of red capsicums or bell peppers. These are also called as cherry peppers.

title: Spinach
description: You can either make a vegetable dish out of it or use it to make burgers, sandwiches and rolls. It may be used in salads.

title: Onion
description: Onions are available in yellow, red or purple and white color. They are mostly used as a compulsory additive to many savory dishes.

title: Mustard Leaves
description: Mustard leaves is a popular winter vegetable. They are broad dark green leaves with a flat surface.

title: Mushroom
description: Mushrooms are fleshy, edible fungi that are a low-calorie food and a good source of Vitamin B.

title: Radish
description: The radish is a root vegetable native to the Europeans. They are white in color and are mainly used in salads but can be cooked or steamed as well.

title: Coriander Powder
description: Grounded from coriander seeds, coriander powder is an essential condiment in the Indian cuisine. It has a pleasing aroma and savour.

title: Chives
description: Belonging to the family of onions, Chives are their smallest member. The tiny bulbs have long, thin and hollow green leaves.

title: Galangal
description: Galangal is a herb like ginger that belongs to the rhizome family. Also known as Thai or blue ginger, it has many medicinal and culinary properties.

title: Tulsi
description: Tulsi is a green leaf herb with excellent aromatic properties.

title: Sage
description: Sage is a herb that is native to the Mediterranean. It has gray-green leaves that have a pungent smell and a minty taste. It is mostly used for seasoning.

title: Rosemary
description: Rosemary is an herb that is used in food for flavoring purpose or for fragrance. Native to the Mediterranean, Rosemary has needle shaped leaves that are highly aromatic.

title: Yellow Chilies
description: Yellow chili peppers offer a sweet pepper flavor and a heat that can vary from very mild to moderately hot.

title: Oregano
description: Oregano is an aromatic herb that is native to northern Europe. It is known for its aromatic and medicinal properties since ancient times.

title: Nasturtium
description: Nasturtium is a plant whose leaves and flower both are edible. Fresh and bright nasturtium leaves and flowers have a pepper-like flavor and are nice to use in salads.

title: Salt
description: Salt is unrefined sodium chloride, an essential ingredient while cooking food worldwide.

title: Mustard Powder
description: A popular condiment for various dishes like pickles and chutney, salad dressing and meat flavoring due to its pungent flavor.

title: Paprika
description: Used mainly to add color to the dishes as it has very mild flavor. It is a deep red coarse powder.

title: Mint Leaves
description: Mint is a type of herb with a refreshing flavor. It has a sweet flavor with a cool after taste.

title: Marjoram
description: An herb from a sage like plant, Marjoram is commonly used a cooking spice.

title: Lemongrass
description: Lemon grass is a tall perennial grass. It tastes somewhat like ginger with a citrus kick.

title: Red Chili
description: Dried red pepper may be used whole or powdered. It is really spicy and the intense heat is concentrated in the seeds. Fresh red chillies are milder.

title: Saffron
description: A unique flavored spice, made from the dried stamens of the crocus flower. It is used as a seasoning in many Asian cuisines.

title: Dried Fenugreek Leaves
description: Fenugreek leaves are an ancient spice used for flavoring various dishes. The leaves have a bitter taste, but when added to the recipe, titillate the taste buds.

title: Amaranth
description: Amaranth is a tall, bushy plant whose seeds are edible. Similar to quinoa, amaranth belongs to the family of beets, chard, spinach and other weeds.

title: Flour
description: Flour, also known as all-purpose or refined flour, is made from wheat grains after removing the brown covering.

title: Oats
description: A type of cereal grain grown for its seed. Most of its taste comes from the roasting process after it has been harvested and cleaned.

title: Brown Rice
description: Brown rice is a variety of rice that is un-milled or partly milled and is considered as a whole grain.

title: Barnyard Millet
description: These are tiny, white, round grains belonging to the millet family. It is sticky once it is cooked and stays a bit soggy.

title: Tapioca
description: Tapioca is a starch extracted from the cassava plant. They are soft, spongy and chewy in taste.

title: Buckwheat
description: Buckwheat grain is the dried and de-husked seed of the plant. It has a nutty flavor which means that it can be consumed raw or simply roasted.

title: Kidney Beans
description: These beans are reddish brown in color and have a kidney like shape. They have a very strong taste and are used in both hot and cold recipes.

title: Beef
description: Meat from cows is known as 'Beef'. Beef meat can be cut into steak, roasts or short ribs.

title: Turkey
description: Turkey is often used as a substitute for chicken. Turkey is often preferred over beef as it has lower calorie content.

title: Pork
description: Pork is the culinary title for the meat obtained from a domestic pig. It is available in different cuts like tenderloin, loin chops, bacon etc.

title: Partridge
description: The native grey partridge is a small bird which is usually pale and highly flavored. Red-legged partridge is a bigger bird with much milder flavor.

title: Meat Stock
description: Meat stock is nothing more than meat flavored broth but can provide character to many dishes since it comes loaded with flavor.

title: Ham
description: Ham is the cured and smoked hind leg of a pig. All hams are mostly fully cooked or preserved in salt and sugar, but fresh ham is also available.

title: Crab
description: A crab is a crustacean that is usually found in coastal waters. It is related to the family of lobster, crayfish and shrimp.

title: Chicken Stock
description: Stock forms an important base in soups and sauces. It is a light, clear, flavorful liquid. You can prepare it at home or buy stock cubes or bouillon cubes which dissolve in water.

title: Chicken
description: Chicken is the most common poultry in the world. Chicken is rich in proteins, potassium, calcium and contains no carbohydrates.

title: Chops
description: A chop is referred to a thin boneless portion of meat cut from the ribs of the animal. The most commonly kinds of chops are pork and lamb.

title: Gouda Cheese
description: Gouda is a yellow Dutch cheese made from cow's milk. It is a semi-hard cheese popular for its rich, unique flavour and smooth texture.

title: Feta Cheese
description: Feta is a type of Greek cheese. It has a very soft and creamy texture. It is mostly produced in blocks and is crumbly.

title: Milk
description: Milk is a dairy product derived from the mammary gland of mammals, usually cows. It is often converted into dairy products like cheese, butter, curd, cream etc.

title: Brie Cheese
description: Brie is a type of French cheese made with cow's milk. It is slightly pale in colour with a greyish tinge under the rind. The rind is a white mould and is edible.

title: Cream Cheese
description: This cheese has a soft creamy texture with a high fat content. Cream cheese is essentially made from un-skimmed cow milk and enriched with cream.

title: Ricotta Cheese
description: Ricotta is made from milk whey that is left from the production of cheese. It is soft and creamy and does not contain salt which gives it a very light and sweet flavor with a light fluffy texture.

title: Parmesan Cheese
description: Parmesan cheese is made from raw cow's milk. It is a hard granulated cheese that is cooked but not pressed. Parmesan cheese has a fruity nutty taste.

title: Blue Cheese
description: Blue cheese is characterized by the blue mold spots throughout the body. Blue cheese has a sharp salty taste.

title: Cheddar Cheese
description: Cheddar cheese is a hard and natural cheese made from cow's milk. Its flavor can range from sharp to mild depending on its make.

title: Mascarpone Cheese
description: Mascarpone Cheese is double or triple cream cheese with a sweeter taste. It is milky-white in color and is easy to spread.

title: Cream
description: Cream is made out of milk and is a dairy product. Cream is the milk fat that accumulates if milk is allowed to sit undisturbed for a while.

title: Provolone Cheese
description: Provolone cheese is an Italian cheese with a smokey flavor. It is golden-yellow in color.

title: Mozzarella Cheese
description: Mozzarella is a semi-soft cheese with a mild taste, though some kinds may have a bitter or sour aftertaste. It is often used in pizza.

title: Yogurt
description: Yogurt is a fermented milk product which is known for its subtle taste and consistency.It is sold sweetened and flavored and can be served with various kinds of fruit.

title: Cottage Cheese
description: Made from curdling milk and straining the whey. Cottage cheese can be eaten raw or cooked. It has a moist texture.

title: Cranberry
description: Cranberries are initially white, but they turn deep red when fully ripe. It has a somewhat acidic taste that adds to its sweetness.

title: Kiwi
description: Kiwi fruit is an edible berry that has a soft texture and sweet flesh with a fibrous brown skin.

title: Blueberries
description: Blueberries are a sweet berry eaten whole or also commonly processed into jams, jellies, blueberry pies, etc.

title: Mango
description: Mango fruits have a rich and aromatic flavor. The inside flesh is soft yellow, pulpy and juicy with an inedible stone.

title: Watermelon
description: Belonging to the same family as cucumber, pumpkin and gourd, watermelon is actually a vegetable! It is, however, consumed as a fruit for it juicy flesh.

title: Tomato
description: Though botanically a fruit, Tomato is often regarded as a vegetable. Tomatoes are a versatile fruit and greatly used in diverse meal courses in varied forms.

title: Strawberry
description: Widely appreciated for its distinctive aroma, fiery red color and juicy taste, strawberries are seen as a luxurious berry.

title: Water Chestnut
description: Water Chestnuts are not nuts; instead, they are a floating aquatic plant that grows in marshes. They have a sweet taste with a slight crunch, somewhat nutty.

title: Papaya
description: It is a tropical fruit that has a sweet taste, soft texture and are pear shaped.The black seeds of papaya are actually edible and have a peppery taste.

title: Orange Rind
description: Orange rind, also called orange zest, is the colored outer skin peeled from an orange. It is aromatic and strong when taken from a fresh orange.

title: Orange
description: Oranges are a sweet fruit of the same color, mostly consumed whole or in slices, or made into orange juice.

title: Olives
description: Olives are either green or black in color though the color does not signify its maturity. They are mostly available bottled as they are naturally bitter and hence are cured with lyre, salt or brine.

title: Pear
description: The pear is a fruit that is juicy and can have a mildly acidic to sweet taste. It typically has a rounded body that tapers into a neck.

title: Mulberry
description: The fruits turn pink to dark purple or black. It is about 2-3 cms long and has a sweet, tarty flavor. It is similar to blackberry but with a very discreet flavor of its own.

title: Lychee
description: Lychee is a fruit which has an extremely juicy whitish pulp and is usually eaten fresh. It is very sweet and tarty in taste. The fruit is oval shaped.

title: Lemon Juice
description: The juice extracted by crushing the pulp of lemon fruit. Lemon juice is most commonly used in a drink called lemonade which is made by using lemon juice, water and sugar.

title: Lemon Rind
description: Lemon rind is the peel of the lemon. The outer yellow part of the rind is used a lot for flavouring of cakes, tarts, salads. It is usually grated to add flavour to the food.

title: Shrimp
description: The term 'shrimp' term is used broadly and covers a variety of species. Shrimps are mainly characterized by semi-transparent bodies which are flattened from side to side with a flexible abdomen.

title: Tuna Fish
description: Tuna is a saltwater fish that belongs to the mackerel family. Tuna meat has a flaky texture and rich flavor with high oil content.

title: Sardines
description: Sardines are silvery, small, oily seawater fish that are soft-boned. They are famously salty, partly due to the way they are generally preserved.

title: Salmon
description: Salmon is a fresh water fish that is from the same family as trout. It has a pink-orange colored flesh.

title: Prawns
description: Prawns are shrimp-like seafood that are 3-5 cm in length. Although larger than shrimp, they taste similar.

title: Perch
description: Perch fish are usually long and rounded with rough scales. These fishes are carnivorous and usually feed on smaller fishes. They are freshwater fish and have tasty, firm meat.

title: Mussels
description: Mussels are marine bivalves. Mussel is the common title used for a variety of clams: what differentiates them is their elongated shells.

title: Squids
description: Squids belong to a class of mollusks known as Cephalopods. Their meat is firm and chewy having a sweet taste. Squid is popularly marketed as Calamari in many English-speaking countries.

title: Fish Stock
description: Flavored strained liquid made from fresh fish parts, water and seasoning is often termed as fish stock. Fish stock is used to flavor soups and etc.

title: Brown Sugar
description: Brown sugar is a product of sucrose sugar. It is brown in color because of the presence of molasses in it.

title: Honey
description: Honey is a thick, sticky and sweet tasting liquid that bees produce by taking the nectar from flowers. It is used in desserts, jams, beverages etc.

title: Caramel
description: A dark brown confectionery item produced using any type of sugar. It is a thick sweet liquid used as a flavoring, filling and topping for various recipes.

title: Cane Sugar
description: Cane sugar is sugar extracted from sugar cane. It is the most commonly used sugar or sweetening agent.

title: Canola Oil
description: Canola oil comes from the crushed seeds of the canola plant. Canola oil has a pale golden colour, light texture, neutral taste and high heat tolerance.

title: Hazelnut
description: Hazelnuts grow in clusters on the hazel tree. The nut has an off-white creamy colour and a mildly sweet taste whereas the thin dark brown skin is mildly bitter.

title: Pine Nuts
description: Edible seeds taken from the pine trees. The oblong seeds are taken from several varieties of pine trees. The seeds are crunchy, sweet and very delicious.

title: Sunflower Seeds
description: Sunflower seeds are the fruit of the beautiful, bright yellow coloured sunflower. Shelled seeds have mild nutty taste, but tender texture.

title: Sesame Oil
description: Edible oil made using sesame seeds, it is used as cooking oil and to enhance flavor.

title: Pistachio
description: Pistachios are dry hard-shelled nuts. Its kernel can be eaten whole, either fresh or roasted and salted.

title: Olive Oil
description: Olive oil has a very subtle aroma. It is a very versatile ingredient and is often used in cooking and is preferred more than other forms of oils as it has a lesser fat and butter content.

title: Poppy Seeds
description: Tiny oil seeds from the opium poppy flower that has a nutty flavour. The seeds may be used whole, ground or to extract poppy seed oil.

title: Sesame Seeds
description: Sesame seeds have a nutty taste and are used in several dishes and as crispy garnish.

title: Peanuts
description: Peanuts are a nutritious legume found all over the world. They can be used for dozens of purposes and are the main ingredient in peanut butter.

title: Cashew Nuts
description: Cashew nuts are a mild and soft nut, often paired with stronger-tasting nuts like peanuts.

title: Almonds
description: Almonds are a dried fruit that is very nutritious. Almonds can be used in many forms, such as sliced (flaked, slivered), almond butter, almond milk and almond oil.

title: Walnuts
description: Walnuts are an edible, hard shelled dry fruit used in main dishes and sweets and desserts.

title: Almond Milk
description: Almond milk is a beverage made with ground almonds. It is often used as a substitute for cow's milk for those who are lactose intolerant or follow a vegan diet.

title: Red Wine Vinegar
description: Vinegar is a liquid that consists of acetic acid and water. Red Wine Vinegar is made from red wine.

title: Red Wine
description: Red wine is produced from the dark-coloured grape varieties. It ranges from light to dark depending on how long it has been aged for.

title: Soy Milk
description: Soy milk is a very nutritious and made from soaking, grinding and then boiling soy beans with water. It is naturally high in fatty acids, proteins, fiber, vitamins and minerals.

title: White Wine
description: White wine is produced by the fermentation of black or white grape pulp. White wine can be yellowish green, straw yellow or golden yellow in color.

title: Yeast
description: A microscopic living fungus that is an essential ingredient in bread making and brewing.

title: Rice Vinegar
description: It is made by fermenting rice. Due to its mild and sweet flavor, it is an ideal ingredient for sweet and tangy dishes, salad dressing and for pickling.

title: Sea Salt
description: As the title suggests, sea salt is obtained from the sea after the water evaporates. The salt is initially in a crystallized form, which can be ground as well.

title: Hoisin Sauce
description: It is a Chinese sauce pronounced as 'HOY-sin' sauce. It is dark in colour with a thick consistency. It has three predominant flavors - salty, spicy and sweet.

title: Vinegar
description: Vinegar is a liquid mainly consisting of acetic acid and water. Vinegar is of many kinds, malt vinegar being one of them.

title: Chocolate Chips
description: Chocolate chips are small bits of chocolate. They are available in different sizes, large to miniature. They contain a smaller amount of cocoa butter than cooking chocolate.

title: Quinoa
description: Often considered a grain, quinoa is actually a seed. It is not a cereal grass but is cooked in a similar way to rice or barley.

title: Rice Flour
description: A type of flour that is made from finely milled rice. It is either made from white rice or brown rice. It is a good substitute for wheat flour and for those who are gluten intolerant.

title: Polenta
description: It is cornmeal that is made from ground maize. It is either eaten directly or is consumed baked, grilled or fried. It has a rich yellow colour, and has a slight sweet taste.

title: Oyster Sauce
description: Oyster sauce is a thick brown sauce extracted from boiled oysters and seasonings. The oyster extracts give the sauce a sweet and salty flavor.
